lead_paragraph: DORNBUSCH--Sanford M. Sanford ("Sandy") Dornbusch, born in New York City on June 5, 1926, died at home in Palo Alto, CA, February 9, 2016. He and his wife and sweetheart Barbara ("Red") enjoyed a rich and adventurous marriage of 65 years. He spent most of his career as a sociologist at Stanford University, where he was a recognized researcher in the social sciences and was one of the founders of the Program in Human Biology. He was the first President of the Stanford University Faculty Senate. He loved teaching and mentoring his students, maintaining lifelong connections. He was a lively and loving husband and father. Sandy was an engaging storyteller and the center of our family. He is survived by his wife Barbara (Palo Alto), sons Steven (Los Angeles) and Jeff (Albuquerque, NM), sister Doris Lowenthal (New York, NY), and his adoring granddaughters Leah Dornbusch (San Francisco) and Hannah Martinelli (Madison, WI). Sandy's unique intelligence, wit and charm will be sorely missed by numerous friends, relatives and colleagues. A celebration of his life will take place at 3pm Saturday, March 19, 2016 in the Auditorium at the Vi, 620 Sand Hill Road, Palo Alto, CA. In lieu of flowers, donations payable to Stanford University, directed to the Professor Sandy Dornbusch Fund (benefitting areas in Sociology, Human Biology, and Art), may be made via Stanford Development Services, PO Box 20466, Stanford, CA 94309-0466 (credit card by phone, 866-543-0243). 1/3
